body:
You actually need `option_as_alt` here, likely in a

```toml
[window]
option_as_alt = "Both"
```

form, alternatively, you can bind `"¬"` since that's what you're pressing in the logs.

I've tried setting `option_as_alt = "Both"` already, but that doesn't change anything.

Mapping `"¬"` feels a bit weird, but it does seem to work. Yet it feels like a bit of a dirty hack, no?
The result that is being printed `"¬"` is actually the result of pressing `alt+l`. So I still believe there is a problem with the bindings in that it does not properly process `"Alt|Command"`

>The result that is being printed "¬" is actually the result of pressing alt+l. 

I know, and `option_as_alt` should remove that, so `alt + l` becomes `\e[l`, if this option doesn't change anything, maybe you're not putting it in the right config?

Try `alacritty -o 'window.option_as_alt="Both"'`.

Doesn't seem to change anything:

```

```

Hm, I actually remembered that it should change `Alt + l`, but not `Command + Alt + l`, I'm not sure why the decision was to keep original for `Command` as well.

Though, I think the way to approach would be to try using `key_without_modifiers` to get more keys...
Not sure if I understand what you mean by that? Is that documented somewhere?

> I'm not sure why the decision was to keep original for Command as well.

Curious what the reasoning for that one is, as I would expect it to either threat the options as `Atl` or not. Seems weird to me to only threat it as such when pressed individually.
I really don't remember what the reason for that was and I'm not sure upstream will easily change, I'll work on a patch in alacritty.

issue.title: Use pre-composed key for `Alt` bindings on macOS

body: I think this should fix your issue https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/pull/7484
Cool! I will compile Alacritty locally to check/verify this solves the issue as soon as I have some time (hopefully later today)...

I just build and tested Alacritty with your patch, but it still gives me the same behavior (after adding the config below)... Do I need to configure or set anything else? EDIT: Trying to start with `alacritty -o 'window.option_as_alt="Both"'` gives the same result

Hi.

I also struggle to make any keybindings with the "Alt" key to work. Weirdly, keybindings with an "Alt" key as the sole modifier work just fine. I am happy to participate and help with debugging.

Example.
```
# Command + Alt doesnt work 👎
{ key = "l", mods = "Command|Alt", action = "SelectNextTab" },
{ key = "h", mods = "Command|Alt", action = "SelectPreviousTab" },

# Alt only works file 👍
{ key = "l", mods = "Alt", action = "SelectNextTab" },
{ key = "h", mods = "Alt", action = "SelectPreviousTab" },
```
I think it should be fixed on the branch I've linked, I did a typo, so it just wasn't working.
Tested again and works like a charm 👍🏻 Thanks for the fix @kchibisov!
